item.title: Eight female bodies recovered from Nairobi dump: Police
item.description: A total of eight bodies, all of them female, have been recovered so far from a dumpsite in a Nairobi slum, Kenya's acting police chief said on Sunday. Kanja took up his post only this week after the resignation of national police chief Japhet Koome in the wake of public fury over the deaths of dozens of protesters during anti-government demonstrations last month. txw/gv

item.title: World leaders react to Trump shooting at rally
item.description: world leaders reaction

item.title: As Gaza war rages, Palestinian culture stifled in Israel
item.description: Comedian Ayman Nahas said he has kept a "low profile" since October 7, fearing reprisals as an Arab artist in Israel while the country wages war in the Gaza Strip. He is one of many Arab artists in Israel or annexed east Jerusalem who describe facing increasing hostility and harassment, and fearing looming funding cuts or arrests.

item.title: Is Biden behind Trump's assassination attempt? What Trump's potential running mates said
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: France's Bastille Day parade meets the Olympic torch relay in an exceptional year
item.description: Paris celebrated Bastille Day marking the 1789 Bastille storming. Macron reviewed military in a D-Day re-enactment. With 130,000 police, events featured French Foreign Legion, Marseillaise, and Concorde Plaza transformation. The Olympic torch relay included bicycle cadets and an equestrian gold medalist. Macron supported Ukraine amidst political turmoil, ensuring security for the high-profile upcoming Olympics.

item.title: 'Staged', 'Antifa activist', 'attack led by left': Conspiracy theories flood online after shooting at Trump rally
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US based airlines bans employees to wear any badge over 'Hamas badges' row
item.description: Delta Airlines prohibits flight attendants from displaying any country flags on uniforms after controversy over Palestinian flag pins. Employee removed for violating company rules. CAIR captures deleted post. Delta issues apology and aims for a safe environment for all passengers.

item.title: 'I love you dad': Ivanka's heartfelt note for dad after assassination attempt
item.description: Ivanka Trump thanked Secret Service and law enforcement after Donald Trump was shot in the ear at a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania. "Thank you for your love and prayers for my father and for the other victims of today's senseless violence in Butler, Pennsylvania. I am grateful to the Secret Service and all the other law enforcement officers for their quick and decisive actions today," Ivanka said. "I continue to pray for our country. I love you Dad, today and always," she added.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Video footages show Trump shooter on roof, Secret Services snipers take aim at him

item.title: Trump assassination attempt: Who was the shooter?
item.description: A 20-year-old man from Pennsylvania has been identified by the FBI as the suspected shooter in the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump. The incident occurred on Saturday during a rally in Pennsylvania. The FBI has not yet released the suspect's name as they continue their investigation into the attack. According to Richard Goldinger, the local prosecutor, the assailant was positioned on the rooftop of a manufacturing facility located outside the event grounds.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Sniper shot Trump with AR-style rifle from over 130 yards'

item.title: 'Clearly see him with a rifle': Eyewitness of Trump attack who saw shooter and warned police
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Video: Moment Donald Trump was attacked during rally
item.description: On Sunday, in Butler County, Pennsylvania, Trump's rally was disrupted by gunfire. Trump grimaced, clutching his ear as he bled after a bullet grazed him, then escorted offstage by Secret Service. Panic ensued, attendees fled, some recorded. Trump, wearing a MAGA cap, raised his fist and lamented on TruthSocial. One attendee and the shooter died.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It sounded like July 4 pops': Witnesses recount chaos at Trump rally after gun attack
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump's election campaign rally took an unexpected turn when a series of popping sounds caused the crowd of thousands to seek cover in a panic. The Secret Service agents acted swiftly to ensure the safety of the 78-year-old Republican, inadvertently knocking over the lectern bearing his name in their haste. As the agents helped Trump regain his footing, they quickly guided him towards his waiting motorcade.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden press conference gets audience of 25.1 million viewers
Gunshots at former US President Donald Trump's rally; suspect, one attendee dead
item.description: Former President Trump was removed from a rally in Pennsylvania after gunshots were heard during a rally, with visible blood on his face. Law enforcement swiftly responded and rushed Trump off the stage. Later it was reported that the suspect and an one attendee are dead. Trump was reported safe and receiving medical attention. President Biden and former President Obama have commented on the incident, advocating for political civility and expressing relief at Trump's safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
